issue.title: Win64 CI failure in feature_versionbits_warning.py
issue.body:
https://cirrus-ci.com/task/6148314429652992?logs=functional_tests#L2861

```
 test  2023-07-19T19:45:37.140000Z TestFramework (ERROR): Assertion failed 
                                   Traceback (most recent call last):
                                     File "C:\Users\ContainerAdministrator\AppData\Local\Temp\cirrus-ci-build\test\functional\test_framework\test_framework.py", line 131, in main

                                     File "C:\Users\ContainerAdministrator\AppData\Local\Temp\cirrus-ci-build\test\functional\test_framework\test_framework.py", line 578, in restart_node
                                       self.stop_node(i)
                                     File "C:\Users\ContainerAdministrator\AppData\Local\Temp\cirrus-ci-build\test\functional\test_framework\test_framework.py", line 564, in stop_node
                                       self.nodes[i].stop_node(expected_stderr, wait=wait)
                                     File "C:\Users\ContainerAdministrator\AppData\Local\Temp\cirrus-ci-build\test\functional\test_framework\test_node.py", line 360, in stop_node
                                       self.wait_until_stopped(expected_stderr=expected_stderr)
                                     File "C:\Users\ContainerAdministrator\AppData\Local\Temp\cirrus-ci-build\test\functional\test_framework\test_node.py", line 394, in wait_until_stopped
                                       wait_until_helper(lambda: self.is_node_stopped(expected_ret_code=expected_ret_code, **kwargs), timeout=timeout, timeout_factor=self.timeout_factor)
                                     File "C:\Users\ContainerAdministrator\AppData\Local\Temp\cirrus-ci-build\test\functional\test_framework\util.py", line 265, in wait_until_helper
                                       if predicate():
                                     File "C:\Users\ContainerAdministrator\AppData\Local\Temp\cirrus-ci-build\test\functional\test_framework\test_node.py", line 394, in <lambda>
                                       wait_until_helper(lambda: self.is_node_stopped(expected_ret_code=expected_ret_code, **kwargs), timeout=timeout, timeout_factor=self.timeout_factor)
                                     File "C:\Users\ContainerAdministrator\AppData\Local\Temp\cirrus-ci-build\test\functional\test_framework\test_node.py", line 374, in is_node_stopped
                                       assert return_code == expected_ret_code, self._node_msg(
                                   AssertionError: [node 0] Node returned unexpected exit code (3) vs (0) when stopping
 test  2023-07-19T19:45:37.140000Z TestFramework (DEBUG): Closing down network thread
```

events.body:
> `AssertionError: [node 0] Node returned unexpected exit code (3) vs (0) when stopping`

Hello, I think a clue to solve this issue is to find out where the `exit code (3)` is returned? But I didn't find where the `exit code (3)` is returned in the source code.
What do you think?
